TopicTitle: Building a pure nuclear SSTO -- possible?

Articles.Content: Before I go and try to figure it out myself, I just want to check if it's possible to build a pure nuclear SSTO to LKO? To Mun? (Inspired by this)

The stock nuclear engine is tuned strictly for vacuum operation. At sea level, its thrust output is too low for meaningful propulsion, even on a plane. I mean, on Duna it could work, but not on Kerbin.

That said, there are mods which offer better atmospheric nukes, or even more exotic things like thermal turbojets.

Edited December 20, 2016 by Streetwind
I'm comfortable in saying "no". The nuclear engine doesn't have the Isp or sea-level TWR to manage it.
in stock, the best you can do is a pure LF design, using airbreathers and then nukes
Ksp interstellar has thermal turbojets, which are realistic yet totally overpowered.

A stock LV-N has a sea level t/w under .5. That's not counting the fuel, wings etc. If you were to make it with an infinite number of fuel tanks it would barely have enough DV to reach orbit, but t/w approaching zero.

So no. An all-nuke SSTO isn't possible. Or at least not one that launches from sea level.

Perhaps if you were to launch from the top of a mountain....
